name: tan
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 [ C ] (also suntan) brown skin caused by being in the sun: She came back from Spain with a deep tan. Annabelle was flaunting her tan in a little white dress.
[ U ] a pale yellowish-brown colour: The couch comes in tan and green. The spider varies in colour from light tan to dark brown.
More examplesFewer examplesI've been back from holiday a week and my tan is fading.He was lying in the sun working on his tan.Even a slight tan is a sign of skin damage.Why this obsession with getting a tan?The tights come in black, dark brown, or tan.

pale yellowish-brown in colour: He was wearing a tan sports jacket. The nurse's uniform is finished off with thick tan tights.

tan verb
(COLOUR)
[ I or T ] to become brown, or to make someone's body or skin, etc. brown, from being in the sun: Her skin tans very quickly in the summer. I need to tan my legs before the holiday.
More examplesFewer examplesI'm lucky - I tan easily.They lay tanning themselves on the beach.

tan verb
(LEATHER)
[ T ] to change animal skin into leather using special chemicals such as tannin: Tanning animal hides is one of the dirtiest jobs. The old saddler used to prepare and tan the leather himself.
